result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pietro J Busalacchi is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pietro J Busalacchi

Reporter:  digital recorder - 2:58
Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C. Cuevas.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Drug Diversion Program. Drug Court Diversion Contract signed.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Court adjourned adjudication/sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-07-2014 as Defendant is to appear on 11-10-2014  for participation in the Drug Court Program
Status conference on November 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Luis C. Cuevas in court on behalf of defendant.  Joshua M. Bowland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Adjudication/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Def appeared for drug screening.  Full COMPAS evaluation scheduled for 10-7 @ 4:00
Defendant failed to show up for Drug Screening.
Court adjourned adjudication/sentencing hearing and Atty Cuevas to contact Commissioner Meurer to set up drug screening for Defendant; Court will reschedule hearing in approximately 30 days
Adjudication/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned adjudication/sentencing hearing; Defendant had entered a plea to Count 1 and adjudication was withheld for participation in the Deferred Prosecution Program; upon assessment by Deferred Prosecution it was determined that the Defendant had been untruthful at his initial screening and was not appropriate for their program; counsel jointly requested the Court to make a referral for another screening; Court deferred their request and asked Atty Raymond to contact Commissioner Meurer and/or Judge Colas to decide if another screening could be done
Adjudication/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

from DPP advising tha defn withheld or misrepresented information re: history when screen for Drug Court Treatment and self report is basis to that screening; case being referred back to branch for further scheduling.

Status conference on February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per count. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $4,000.00, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant is eligible to be screened for the Drug Court Diversion Program
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
